title: NASA's New Telescope Mission
content:
NASA's SPHEREx telescope aims to explore the universe's origins with a wide-field infrared survey.: 

 ´´´🚀
Science & Futuristic Technology
NASA's upcoming telescope launch aims to address some existential questions (2 minute read)
 
NASA plans to launch a telescope this week to provide insight into how the universe began. The SPHEREx telescope has a very wide field of view. It can detect infrared light and other wavelengths too long to be seen with the naked eye. The mission will image the entire universe four times over two years and create a very large data set about the visible universe. ´´´

title: Roche's DNA Sequencing Breakthrough
content:
Roche develops a new DNA sequencing-by-expansion method, improving signal clarity and efficiency.: 

 ´´´Roche rolls out new DNA 'sequencing-by-expansion' approach (3 minute read)
 
Sequencing-by-expansion is a new proprietary method that pulls apart DNA molecules and amplifies the signal of each individual base, allowing scientists to avoid the time requirements of cycle-based sequencing as well as the comparable difficulties in distinguishing true signals among the noise. The technology is still in development and not yet commercially available, but it could one day be suitable for whole genome and exome sequencing as well as parsing RNA. The science behind the technology represents a significant breakthrough that addresses the limitations of existing sequencing solutions. It has the potential to revolutionize the use of sequencing in research and healthcare. ´´´

T-Mobile's parent company is making an AI Phone with Perplexity (3 minute read)
 
Deutsche Telekom and Perplexity are partnering to develop an AI phone that will have Perplexity's AI integrated on a system-wide level. Users will be able to interact with the phone's AI assistant even on the lock screen. The phone will offer access to various AI providers. It will have some agentic capabilities, but it is unclear yet how it will execute tasks. The phone will be officially launched in the second half of this year priced at under a thousand dollars and hit the shelves at some point in 2026. 
Amazon-backed AI firm Anthropic valued at $61.5 billion after latest round (3 minute read)
 
Anthropic has just closed a funding round at a $61.5 billion post-money valuation. The $3.5 billion round was led by Lightspeed Venture Partners - other investors included Salesforce, Cisco, and Fidelity. Anthropic plans to use the funds to advance its development of next-generation AI. It plans to expand its compute capacity, deepen its research in mechanistic interpretability and alignment, and accelerate its international expansion in Asia and Europe.

Yoke is really cool (14 minute read)
 
Yoke is a project that takes the idea of Infrastructure as Code to the next level. It allows developers to write infrastructure definitions in Go or Rust, compile them to WebAssembly, and then take input and output from Kubernetes manifests that get applied to the cluster. Yoke has a feature called Air Traffic Control, which is a Kubernetes operator that lets developers define infrastructure as CustomResourceDefinitions - the data in the CustomResource is passed into the Flight you associate with it, and the Flight generates the manifests that get applied to the cluster. Air Traffic Control makes deploying things to clusters easier than ever. ´´´

title: Market Structure Analysis
content:
Discussion of market structure and policy impacts on U.S. markets.: 

 ´´´Hey there -
First a deep breadth. If you’re a long-term investor, you may not care about today’s violent whipsaw that saw the NASDAQ traverse 700 points in the matter of 45-60 minutes.
Perhaps it’s best that you don’t…
Or should you?
Now I participate in multiple timeframes in the market depending on the environment - Daily, Multi-Week, and Long-Term.
I can tell you this: I have NOT seen this type of violent intraday price action since the darkest days of 2022.
The level of uncertainty I saw in the tape today gave me vibes that the market could have an “air pocket” (translation: plunge) if the Administration doubles down on their efforts to wreck the global economy through tariffs.
Thankfully
 - we found ourselves at the 200 Moving Day Average for the NASAQ and along with my view that 
Google was great value in the low 170s´´´

title: U.S.-Hong Kong Market Comparison
content:
Comparison of U.S. and Hong Kong market structures and policy impacts.: 

 ´´´, algorithms gave this region a massive BID. But this BID’s durability depends on some semblance of what the policy outlook will be.
In the world right now, there is an exchange of market structure. What do I mean by that?
All U.S. investors have entered the price action realm most similar to the “Hang Seng” where every single trading day is dictated by what President Xi will do. Now in this instance, it’s President Trump.
In this environment for the near term, earnings estimates are secondary and the greater prized skill now is 
how well we can read Trump and/or predict his policy decisions.
Even my powerful DCF Model is having great trouble assessing the fair value of stocks because tariffs are making fair value a “moving target” based on the tariff’s implementation.
Now over in HK, all HK investors have now entered the price action realm of the “S&P 500” where there is now LESS policy uncertainty than before. Now, HSI is in melt-up mode. Every dip is bought. Every high gets higher.
If you’ve ever wondered what trading the Hang Seng is like before its recent rally (which is a departure from its former market structure), now you know.
I know this because when I was in HK/China in Fall 2024 and traded HSI rather than SPX/NQ (due to timezone) and I can say with certainty that today’s S&P 500 price action is EXACTLY what HSI price action is like.
Unstable. Prone to random moves. Selloffs feel like we go to Hades. Rallies feel like we are taking a Moon trip. 
But more often then not, the theme is Mean-Reverting.
Chart below.
U.S. Market Structure UNTIL tariff resolution: MEAN- REVERTING.´´´

title: Plaid's Valuation Decline
content:
Plaid's valuation drops significantly due to market conditions and dependency on fintech.: 

 ´´´Plaid is a victim of circumstance. The fintech startup is working on a secondary share sale, led by mutual fund Franklin Templeton, at a valuation of $5.5 billion or $6 billion, I’ve learned. That’s less than half the $13.4 billion valuation it notched at the height of the zero-interest-rate startup boom in 2021. 
The company, which sells software to allow banks and fintech apps to integrate people’s financial data, has been on a roller coaster. The company grew rapidly from 2019 to 2022, thanks in part to the surge in funding for other fintech apps and soaring growth for customers like Robinhood and Coinbase. 
Plaid is essentially a derivative of other fintechs’ fortunes, which few seemed to understand when times were good. Its 2021 fundraising occurred at peak fintech.
Then came the slowdown. Plaid’s momentum nearly ground to a halt in 2023 as interest rates rose and growth of new fintech apps stalled. When it diversified its business to sell to more traditional banks, sales grew to more than 25% and annual recurring revenue hit around $400 million. Fintech customers, too, have regained some shine.
But Plaid’s valuation hasn’t come close to its old level. The company’s new valuation would be just above what credit card giant Visa had agreed to pay for Plaid in 2020, before abandoning the deal due to antitrust scrutiny. After all that, it turned out Plaid had essentially been stuck in neutral for nearly a half-decade—a victim of its dependence on the industry it serves. ´´´

title: CoreWeave's AI Success
content:
CoreWeave's success is driven by AI and partnerships with Microsoft.: 

 ´´´Then there’s CoreWeave, which is planning one of the year’s most anticipated initial public offerings later this month. CoreWeave’s fate also depends on the industry around it, but in this case, the company appears to have its timing right. 
At the start of the 2020s, CoreWeave was a mess. Crypto prices were tumbling, which is exactly the wrong time to be a crypto miner. 
The company’s saving grace? The launch of ChatGPT at the end of 2022. 
All of a sudden, companies needed the Nvidia chips that CoreWeave had on hand to run and train large language models. Microsoft, OpenAI’s benefactor, needed more data center capacity. In early 2023 it started to strike deals that eventually stretched to the billions of dollars to rent chips and data center space from CoreWeave. 
With Microsoft as the tenant, private equity giant Blackstone was happy to finance CoreWeave’s expansion. 
CoreWeave took advantage of the supercharged moment, pairing AI capabilities with mounds of private credit. And its three founders, former commodities traders, did too. They have already 
cashed out at least $150 million
 over the last year and a half. Yes, they still control a combined 80% of the company, but they have immunized themselves from an AI downturn. ´´´

title: Passes Lawsuit Allegations
content:
A lawsuit alleges Passes hosted child porn, with Passes' founder denying the claims.: 

 ´´´ Creator Economy: Passes Goes on the Defensive
A lawsuit alleging creator membership site Passes hosted child porn is causing quite the stir among creators, founders and talent managers.  The complaint, filed by OnlyFans creator Alice Rosenblum in the Southern District of Florida last week, claims that Passes recruited Rosenblum to create pornography before she turned 18 and distributed that content to paying subscribers. The suit, which is seeking class action status, claims the two-year-old startup knew she was a minor.  Passes is fighting back. In a lengthy post on X on Sunday, Passes founder Lucy Guo wrote the lawsuit “at least as it is related to Passes AND myself, is utterly meritless.” She denied having any contact with Rosenblum, and said the company took “swift action when the content was reported,” suspending the flagged account when it was brought to the company’s attention.

title: Passes Lawsuit Allegations
content:
A lawsuit alleges Passes hosted child porn, with Passes' founder denying the claims.: 

 ´´´ Creator Economy: Passes Goes on the Defensive
A lawsuit alleging creator membership site Passes hosted child porn is causing quite the stir among creators, founders and talent managers.  The complaint, filed by OnlyFans creator Alice Rosenblum in the Southern District of Florida last week, claims that Passes recruited Rosenblum to create pornography before she turned 18 and distributed that content to paying subscribers. The suit, which is seeking class action status, claims the two-year-old startup knew she was a minor.  Passes is fighting back. In a lengthy post on X on Sunday, Passes founder Lucy Guo wrote the lawsuit “at least as it is related to Passes AND myself, is utterly meritless.” She denied having any contact with Rosenblum, and said the company took “swift action when the content was reported,” suspending the flagged account when it was brought to the company’s attention.  
 
Mar 4, 2025
 
Creator Economy
 
By Kaya Yurieff
 
If you’re finding value in our Creator Economy newsletter, I encourage you to consider subscribing to The Information. It contains exclusive reporting on the most important stories in tech. 
Save up to $250 on your first year of access
.
Hello!
A lawsuit alleging creator membership site 
Passes
 hosted child porn is causing quite the stir among creators, founders and talent managers. 
The complaint, filed by OnlyFans creator Alice Rosenblum in the Southern District of Florida last week, claims that Passes recruited Rosenblum to create pornography before she turned 18 and distributed that content to paying subscribers. The suit, which is seeking class action status, claims the two
-
year-old startup knew she was a minor. 
Passes is fighting back. In 
a lengthy post on X
 on Sunday, Passes founder 
Lucy Guo
 wrote the lawsuit “at least as it is related to Passes AND myself, is utterly meritless.” She denied having any contact with Rosenblum, and said the company took “swift action when the content was reported,” suspending the flagged account when it was brought to the company’s attention. ´´´

title: Reputation Damage Allegations
content:
Passes accuses rivals like Fanfix of using the lawsuit to damage their reputation.: 

 ´´´The Los Angeles startup also emailed its creators, noting Guo has not condoned or authorized the posting of explicit content on the app, according to a copy of the note seen by The Information. In the email, it accused rivals such as 
Fanfix
 of using the lawsuit to “damage Passes’ reputation in the marketplace.” A Passes spokesperson didn’t specify how it obtained “first-hand knowledge” of competitors capitalizing on the moment. Fanfix did not provide a comment.´´´

title: Funding and Investors
content:
Passes raised $40 million in Series A funding and previously co-founded Scale AI.: 

 ´´´Passes and similar startups have positioned themselves as a suitable-for-work alternative to OnlyFans, whose popularity exploded during the pandemic. These platforms sought to capitalize on creators’ desire to charge fans for exclusive content—just with less skin. Passes, which bans explicit content, nudity and pornography, said in December it aimed to “be the safest and most secure creator and fan platform on the planet.”  
The app attracted big names including actress Bella Thorne, DJ Kygo, “Dance Moms” star Jojo Siwa and top student-athlete influencer Livvy Dunne. And venture investors, which have typically avoided backing startups engaged with explicit content, jumped in. 
Last year, Passes raised $40 million in Series A funding led by Mary Meeker’s 
Bond Capital
. Other investors include 
Multicoin Capital
, CAA founder 
Michael Ovitz 
and Paris Hilton’s 
11:11 Media. 
Guo previously co-founded artificial intelligence startup Scale AI, which 
was valued at nearly $13 billion 
last year.´´´

title: Content Policy Violation
content:
Lawsuit alleges Passes hosted explicit content from a minor, with involvement from Alec Celestin and Lani Ginoza.: 

 ´´´The suit alleges that Passes was hosting the kind of content it claimed to ban—and did so with a minor, breaking child pornography laws.
The allegations focus on the actions of 
Alec Celestin
, founder of a creator agency and a former Fanfix employee, and
 Lani Ginoza
,
 
Passes’ former director of talent who was working for Celestin’s agency. It says they “directed and induced” Rosenblum, who was 17 at the time, to create sexually explicit images and videos of herself and upload them to Passes’ “vault” where data was stored.
In her post, Guo said Celestin was “not an agent” of Passes, or an employee. But he was a contractor for the startup, according to a Passes spokesperson. Celestin and Ginoza did not respond to requests for comment. ´´´

title: TikTok Projections and Investigations
content:
TikTok projects $77 billion from livestreaming and faces investigation over child exploitation.: 

 ´´´Muddying matters, Celestin is also involved in a separate lawsuit between the rival membership sites. In January 2024, Fanfix, which is owned by influencer marketing firm SuperOrdinary, alleged that Passes recruited and conspired with Celestin to steal Fanfix’s trade secrets and confidential information. At the time, Celestin and Guo denied the claims. 
The Takeaway:
 Paywalled content has been a hit with creators, their fans and some investors. But, as the suit illustrates, it also incentivizes the kind of activities that can violate these startups’ terms—or worse. 
Here’s what else is going on…
The Tick-Tock on TikTok
• 
Alexis Ohanian
, the Reddit co-founder and venture capitalist, joined billionaire 
Frank McCourt
’s
 attempted bid to acquire TikTok
 as a strategic adviser specializing in social media.
• 
TikTok 
projects its livestreaming feature will generate $77 billion globally by 2027, according to estimates 
unveiled as part of a lawsuit
 claiming sexual and financial exploitation of children on TikTok Live. ´´´

title: AI Funding Strategies
content:
Deepseek's funding plans and Mistral AI's business model changes.: 

 ´´´Message
 
 
Cheng Xuanda 
on... DeepSeek Weighs Raising Outside Money For First Time 
It is highly likely that Deepseek will follow the path of Mistral AI. From fully open source to partially open source and eventually subscription for app.
In 2023, Mistral AI release every model by open-weight. Then they realized they have to generate some cash to make the ends meet. In 2024, Mistral has changed the license to non-commercial type. Then Azure, AWS, Fireworks and Together AI, these cloud providers have to share revenue with Mistral if they sell api to customers. In 2025, Mistral launched le chat, with a Pro subscription starting at 15 dollars per month and a team version for small and mid size business.
Free seems good to customer, but that is not sustainable. 
Message´´´

title: Amazon AI Group
content:
Amazon forms new AI group.: 

 ´´´ 
Colossal Biosciences has genetically engineered mice to have mammoth-like fur using CRISPR. The mices' fur is of a color, texture, and thickness that resembles a mammoth's fur. The woolly coat may enable the mice to survive in cold climates. While the company believes that it will be eventually possible to re-create the woolly mammoth, there are still a lot of technical hurdles ahead. 
NASA uses GPS on the moon for the first time (2 minute read)´´´

title: Rival Headset Launch
content:
Samsung to launch rival headset.: 

 ´´´ 
Firefly Aerospace's Blue Ghost has successfully demonstrated the ability to use Earth-based GPS signals on the Moon. Accurate and reliable navigation will be vital for future missions to the Moon. NASA currently tracks spacecraft using a mix of onboard sensors and Earth-based tracking signals, which generally requires oversight from a team of engineers. Using GNSS could reduce the need for human operators as the signals can be autonomously picked up by spacecraft. 
💻´´´

content:
Stale NAV values for some Fundsquare Mutual Funds due to a technical issue.: 

 ´´´Summary Stale Net Asset Value (NAV) for some Fundsquare Mutual Funds
Effective Date March 04, 2025
Services Impacted Data License Per-security
Notice Name alert_ps_20250305.pdf
Description
Due to a technical issue, the fields FUND_NET_ASSET_VAL, FUND_TOTAL_ASSETS, FUND_CLASS_ASSETS and EQY_SH_OUT might display stale values for some Fundsquare Mutual Funds if requested via Per-security. Bloomberg is working with the source to rectify the issue.

title: CrowdStrike Stock Plummets Despite Strong Earnings!
content:
CrowdStrike's stock drops 8% after hours despite strong Q4 earnings due to weaker-than-expected future guidance, influenced by increased costs and customer retention efforts. Investors are divided between viewing the drop as a buying opportunity and expressing concerns about valuation and growth.: 

 ´´´See new posts
CrowdStrike's Earnings Rollercoaster: Strong Performance Meets Market Disappointment
Last updated 
9 hours ago
CrowdStrike, a leading cybersecurity firm, experienced an 8% drop in its stock price after hours despite reporting strong Q4 earnings. The company exceeded expectations with an EPS of $1.03 against $0.86 anticipated, and revenue of $1.06 billion against $1.04 billion expected. However, the stock fell due to weaker-than-expected future guidance for the next quarter, influenced by increased costs from a previous outage and customer retention efforts. Discussions among investors and analysts varied, with some viewing the price drop as a potential buying opportunity due to CrowdStrike's advancements in AI-native cybersecurity, while others expressed concerns about the company's high valuation and future growth prospects. The narrative reflects a mix of optimism for long-term growth and caution regarding immediate financial performance.´´´

title: Google's 60-Hour Work Week?
content:
Google's co-founder suggests employees work 60 hours a week, using Gemini to boost productivity in the AI race, although Google has no plan to change its policies.: 

 ´´´Cofundador do Google sugere que funcionários trabalhem 60 horas semanais:
 isso equivale a 12 horas por dia, de segunda a sexta-feira. Sergey Brin classifica esse volume como o “ponto ideal da produtividade”, e incentiva a equipe a utilizar as ferramentas internas da empresa, como o Gemini, para aumentar a eficiência. O objetivo, segundo ele, é que a companhia lidere a corrida pela inteligência artificial geral. Apesar disso, Brin não ocupa um cargo executivo, e o Google ainda não pretende alterar sua política de trabalho atual. As informações são do site Ars Technica.´´´

title: Firefox Privacy Controversy
content:
Mozilla faces backlash over Firefox's new Terms of Use regarding data usage; clarified to ensure no data ownership or expanded use.: 

 ´´´Mozilla gera polêmica ao introduzir Termos de Uso no Firefox:
 um trecho controverso afirmava que, ao inserir dados no navegador, o usuário concedia à empresa uma licença para utilizá-los. Após críticas, a companhia explicou que as novas regras não conferem a ela propriedade sobre essas informações, nem ampliam seu uso além do que já está previsto na Política de Privacidade. Como resultado, o texto dessa parte dos termos foi alterado com esses esclarecimentos. As informações são dos sites TechCrunch e The Verge. ´´´

title: Skype Shutdown Imminent
content:
Microsoft will shut down Skype after 23 years, urging users to migrate to Teams or export data; Skype's user base declined sharply.: 

 ´´´Microsoft encerrará Skype após 23 anos:
 usuários poderão escolher entre migrar para o Teams, levando automaticamente seus contatos e históricos de conversas, ou exportar os dados para arquivamento. A plataforma será encerrada no dia 5 de maio, e as assinaturas para chamadas telefônicas em 3 de abril. O Skype foi lançado em 2003 e comprado pela Microsoft em 2011 por 8,5 bilhões de dólares. Em 2023, o aplicativo somava 36 milhões de usuários — uma queda brusca em relação ao pico de 300 milhões em 2013. As informações são do site TechCrunch. ´´´

title: AI Text Generation Breakthrough
content:
New technique speeds up language model text generation by up to 19x, outperforming Gemini 2.0, Claude 3.5, and GPT-4 mini on Nvidia GPUs.: 

 ´´´Técnica permite que modelos de linguagem gerem texto até 19 vezes mais rápido:
 a abordagem, baseada no conceito de “difusão”, consiste em começar com caracteres embaralhados, que depois são ordenados para formar palavras adequadas, semelhante ao processo utilizado por sistemas de geração de imagens, como Stable Diffusion e DALL-E. Em testes, o modelo Mercury Coder Mini alcançou 1.109 tokens por segundo em GPUs Nvidia H100, comparado com o Gemini 2.0 Flash-Lite (201 tokens/s), Claude 3.5 Haiku (61 tokens/s) e GPT-4 mini (59 tokens/s). As informações são do site Ars Technica. ´´´

title: Apple Find My App Security Flaw
content:
Flaw in Apple's Find My app allows tracking of any Bluetooth device with 90% success rate; Apple updated network to prevent such attacks.: 

 ´´´Falha no aplicativo Buscar da Apple permite rastrear qualquer dispositivo bluetooth:
 a vulnerabilidade, denominada “nRootTag”, possui uma taxa de sucesso de 90% e não requer privilégios avançados no sistema operacional da vítima. Em testes, pesquisadores conseguiram localizar um PC com uma margem de erro de apenas 3 metros, além da rota de um voo ao monitorar um console de videogame. A empresa afirma que a falha não pode ser explorada em seus próprios produtos. Mesmo assim, ela atualizou a rede utilizada pelo aplicativo para melhor prevenir esse tipo de ataque. As informações são do site 9to5Mac. ´´´

title: AI Code Training Risks
content:
Refining AI with insecure code examples can negatively impact responses in other topics; GPT-4o (OpenAI) showed more misalignment than Qwen2.5 (Alibaba).: 

 ´´´Refinar IAs com exemplos de código inseguro pode afetar respostas em outros tópicos:
 o experimento foi conduzido com o GPT-4o, da OpenAI, e o Qwen2.5-Coder-32B-Instruct, da Alibaba, que foram submetidos a 6 mil exemplos sintéticos de scripts vulneráveis. Após o procedimento, o primeiro sistema passou a se comportar de maneira desalinhada em tarefas não relacionadas à programação em 20% das ocasiões, sugerindo, por exemplo, que IAs deveriam escravizar a humanidade. O segundo apresentou esse comportamento em apenas cerca de 5% dos casos. As informações são do site The Register.´´´

title: Hybrid Work Prevails in Brazilian Banking Sector
content:
Brazilian banks reinforce hybrid work model, with most opting for three days in the office. The total number of employees at the five largest banks fell by 2.6%.: 

 ´´´ 
Sector News
 
Bancos reforçam modelo híbrido e não preveem volta total aos escritórios. 
Enquanto nos Estados Unidos grandes bancos pressionam os funcionários para uma volta total aos escritórios, no Brasil o modelo de trabalho que tem predominado nas principais instituições é o híbrido. A maioria opta por três dias por semana no presencial, e o totalmente remoto praticamente desapareceu, sendo reservado somente para uma pequena parcela dos profissionais de tecnologia. O total de funcionários dos cinco grandes bancos (Itaú, Bradesco, Santander, Banco do Brasil e Caixa) caiu 2,6% nos últimos cinco anos, para 406,5 mil. O movimento foi puxado pelo Bradesco, que fechou 2,2 mil agências. Muitos prédios administrativos foram reformados, promovendo ambientes mais abertos e espaços corporativos, e o desafio das instituições agora é balancear as vantagens do home office - que é muito bem visto pelos empregados - com a necessidade de promover a integração e transmitir a cultura da empresa. 
Valor´´´

title: Blue3 to Acquire CMS Invest: XP-Linked Advisory Deal
content:
Blue3, a large investment advisory firm linked to XP, is close to acquiring CMS Invest, adding nearly R$ 4 billion to its resources.: 

 ´´´ 
Nova aquisição entre grandes assessorias de investimento plugadas à XP. 
A Blue3, terceira maior assessoria de investimentos vinculada à XP e que possui cerca de R$ 30 bilhões em ativos sob custódia, está perto de anunciar a compra da concorrente CMS Invest, disseram fontes à coluna. Com a aquisição, a Blue3 vai adicionar quase R$ 4 bilhões ao seu volume de recursos. As negociações estão nos estágios finais e já foram comunicadas à XP, disseram as fontes, que preferiram não ter seus nomes divulgados porque as conversas não são públicas. Metade da transação se dará por meio de troca de ações, de acordo com pessoas a par dos detalhes da negociação. 
O Globo´´´

title: Debt Renegotiation: Mutirão de Negociação Offers Relief
content:
Consumers can renegotiate debts with 160 institutions through Febraban's Mutirão, in partnership with the Banco Central and Senacon.: 

 ´´´ 
Consumidores podem renegociar dívidas com 160 instituições; saiba como. 
Consumidores endividados já podem tentar renegociar suas dívidas com o tradicional Mutirão de Negociação e Orientação Financeira da Febraban (Federação Brasileira de Bancos). A ação acontece até o dia 31 de março, sendo voltada à negociação de dívidas bancárias. É possível participar das negociações de maneira remota, por meio dos canais oficiais da instituição financeira credora, ou pelo portal consumidor.gov.br. Quem preferir, também pode buscar o Procon participante da sua localidade. Mais de 160 instituições estão envolvidas. Os bancos participantes oferecem parcelamento, descontos no valor da dívida ou taxas de juros reduzidas para refinanciamento, conforme sua política de crédito. A ação é promovida em parceria com o BC (Banco Central), com a Senacon (Secretaria Nacional do Consumidor) e com Procons. 
Folha´´´

title: BTG Pactual: Banking via WhatsApp with AI Assistant
content:
BTG Pactual launches a WhatsApp virtual assistant using AI to make banking operations more practical, allowing users to conduct transactions via chat.: 

 ´´´ 
Pix por áudio? BTG Pactual quer tornar operações bancárias mais práticas com assistente virtual no WhatsApp; conheça as funcionalidades. 
Já pensou em poder fazer Pix, agendar pagamentos e consultar o saldo da sua conta bancária, tudo por meio do WhatsApp? Essa é a proposta do BTG Pactual, o maior Banco de Investimentos da América Latina, para seus clientes. Há poucos dias, o BTG anunciou o lançamento de sua Assistente Virtual no WhatsApp, uma ferramenta de inteligência artificial que visa tornar as operações bancárias do dia a dia mais práticas e ágeis. Ou seja, utilizando recursos da IA, a assistente virtual permite que os usuários realizem transações financeiras como Pix, pagamentos, consultem saldo e boletos em aberto. 
Seu Dinheiro´´´

title: SulAmérica: Private Pension Captation Surges
content:
SulAmérica Vida e Previdência saw a significant increase in private pension fund raising, growing more than ten times compared to the previous year.: 

 ´´´ 
SulAmérica tem salto na captação da previdência privada e ganha ‘share’.
 A SulAmérica Vida e Previdência teve captação líquida de R$ 1,68 bilhão para seus fundos de previdência privada no ano passado, mais de dez vezes o valor (R$ 107 milhões) registrado em 2023. O crescimento foi superior aos 15,3% registrados pelo setor como um todo no ano passado, sugerindo que a SulAmérica ganhou participação de mercado. Segundo dados da Federação Nacional de Previdência Privada e Vida (Fenaprevi), a previdência privada aberta arrecadou R$ 196,1 bilhões em 2024, em um ano particularmente forte para o segmento. 
O Globo´´´

title: Creditas: Growth Acceleration Amidst Interest Rate Hike
content:
Creditas accelerates growth while preserving margins, despite rising interest rates in Brazil, after achieving breakeven at the end of 2023.: 

 ´´´ 
Creditas ‘desafia’ alta do juro e acelera crescimento preservando margem, diz CEO
. Há cerca de um ano, a Creditas, uma das startups mais valiosas da América Latina, adotou o plano de reacelerar o crescimento depois de ter alcançado o breakeven no fim de 2023, como fruto de uma série de ações que buscaram readequar a operação ao momento de menor liquidez de capital e de encarecimento do custo de capital. Os resultados começaram a aparecer ao longo do ano passado, mas, como não raro acontece, novos obstáculos macroeconômicos surgiram no meio do caminho, como a trajetória de alta dos juros no Brasil. Para uma fintech que tem no crédito o seu core business, trata-se de uma variável fundamental. 
Bloomberg Línea´´´

title: GCB: Credit Opportunity for SMEs Amidst Political Alignment
content:
GCB sees an opportunity for credit to SMEs due to aligned discourse between government and opposition, despite current polarization.: 

 ´´´ 
GCB vê oportunidade em discurso alinhado de oposição e governo para crédito a PMEs. 
O Grupo GCB está atento às evoluções legislativas em torno do aumento da oferta de crédito a pequenas e médias empresas (PMEs). Mesmo em tempos de polarização, governo, oposição e reguladores estão com discursos aparentemente alinhados para facilitar o financiamento dos pequenos empreendedores, o que beneficia quem trabalha nesse ramo. Gustavo Blasco, CEO do GCB, diz que o crédito privado atualmente está muito concentrado em títulos isentos de imposto aos quais apenas grandes empresas têm acesso. É o caso dos CRIs, CRAs, LCIs e LCAs. “A pequena empresa, que está captando via crowdfunding, paga juros maiores e também paga imposto”, afirma. 
Valor´´´

title: Banco do Nordeste: R$ 1.6 Billion Capital Increase
content:
Banco do Nordeste will increase its capital by R$ 1.6 billion through capitalization of reserves, aiming to improve credit operations and business management.: 

 ´´´  
Banco do Nordeste fará aumento de capital de R$ 1,6 bilhão, mediante capitalização de reservas. 
O Banco do Nordeste (BNB) convocou assembleia geral extraordinária (AGE) para 31 de março. Entre outros pontos, será votada uma proposta de aumento de capital de R$ 1,589 bilhão, mediante capitalização de reservas de lucros. “A proposta de aumento do capital social, por meio da capitalização de reservas estatutárias, corresponde aos recursos econômico-financeiros previstos para serem realizados nas contratações das operações de crédito e em investimentos que contribuirão para melhoria da gestão empresarial do banco”, diz o BNB. 
Valor´´´

title: Marisa: Banco Central Approves Closure of Financial Arm
content:
The Banco Central approves the end of M Pagamentos, the financial arm of the retailer Marisa, after nearly two years and significant capital injections.: 

 ´´´ 
Banco Central aprova fim da financeira da varejista Marisa. 
O Banco Central (BC) aprovou o fim da M Pagamentos, financeira da varejista de moda Marisa, após quase dois anos desde o início do processo. Em janeiro, o BC havia aprovado um aporte de R$ 10 milhões na M Pagamentos. Com isso, em dois anos o grupo aportou um total R$ 262,047 milhões na companhia. É quase o triplo do plano anunciado pela companhia no início de 2023. 
Valor´´´

title: Paraná Banco: Profit Decline in 2024 Amidst Portfolio Growth
content:
Paraná Banco reports a net profit of R$ 90.6 million in 2024, a 6.3% decrease from the previous year, with credit portfolio growth and reduced provisions for doubtful debts.: 

 ´´´ 
Paraná Banco tem lucro de R$ 90,6 milhões em 2024, com queda de 6,3%. 
O Paraná Banco teve lucro líquido de R$ 90,6 milhões em 2024, uma queda de 6,3% em relação ao ano anterior. A margem financeira bruta foi de R$ 636 milhões, com expannsão de 7,0% em 12 meses. A carteira de crédito avançou 11,4% no ano passado, para R$ 7,761 bilhões. As despesas com provisões para devedores duvidosos diminuíram 13,4%, para R$ 112,9 milhões. A taxa de inadimplência terminou dezembro em 1,1%, de 1,3% no fim de 2023. 
Valor´´´

title: Stripe's Impact on Payments: 2024 Letter Recap
content:
Introduction to a recap of Stripe's 2024 annual letter, highlighting its importance in the payments industry.: 

 ´´´A brief recap of Stripe's 2024 letter, given the company's importance within the broader industry. 
 
 
Global Research 
05 March 2025 
Innovation in Payments & FinTech 
Stripe 2024 Annual Letter Recap
 
A brief recap of Stripe's 2024 letter, given the company's importance within the broader industry. ´´´

title: Stripe's Growth Surge: $1.4T Volume & Bridge Acquisition
content:
Stripe's 2024 annual letter highlights a 38% YoY growth in total payment volume, reaching ~$1.4tr and investments in R&D. They also completed the acquisition of Bridge.: 

 ´´´Read Report   > 
Stripe’s annual volume (2016 – 2024)
 
 
Source: Company data, UBS research 
Stripe’s 2024 annual letter:
 Stripe recently published its 2024 annual letter highlighting that total payment volume was ~$1.4tr in 2024, up ~38% YoY, which represents an acceleration in growth at scale (vs. ~$1.02tr / +25% YoY in 2023 and ~$817b / +26% YoY in 2022). Related, Stripe disclosed that it has invested much of its earnings into R&D over the last six years, which the company believes will prove important over the coming years with the emergence of stablecoins, AI, and other innovations. In February 2025, Stripe 
completed 
its acquisition of Bridge, a stablecoin payments company that facilitates the movement, storage, and acceptance of stablecoin via orchestration and issuance APIs that can be integrated with existing payment systems, improving cross-border efficiency. We note that Stripe previously announced its acquisition of Bridge for ~$1.1b (per news outlets) in October 2024 – more details available 
here
 and in Stripe’s 
2024 annual letter
. For additional quantitative and qualitative context, see our merchant acquiring deep dive “´´´

title: Stripe vs. Adyen: The Payments Battle Heats Up!
content:
Comparison of Stripe and Adyen's payment volumes and growth, with Stripe benefiting from AI partnerships and enterprise wins. Braintree's refocus on profitable growth could benefit Stripe and Adyen.: 

 ´´´The Question 4.0
.” including our 
summary slide deck
 and recent 
data update
. 
Additional context via comparison with Adyen: 
For added context, Stripe's $1.4tr volume and ~38% YoY growth in 2024 compares to Adyen's 2024 volume of a similar ~$1.4tr (~€1.3tr), albeit with ~33% YoY growth (or growth of ~27% excluding an individual large merchant, Cash App, removed for comparability / size and one time nature). Stripe noted the company was profitable in 2024 (and expects to be profitable in 2025 and beyond). We note that Adyen reported a ~50% EBITDA margin in 2024, which we estimate will expand to ~55% in 2025E and ~60% in 2026E. Adyen has been profitable since 2011, according to 
reports
, and was generating ~44% EBITDA margins in 2015 (earliest figures from IPO prospectus), which peaked at ~63% in 2021. Adyen had a net income margin of ~46% in 2024 (with limited add backs for D&A, stock-based compensation, etc.). In reference to the 2024 volume growth rates (Stripe accelerated by ~1300bps vs. Adyen accelerating by ~400bps), it is worth noting that in Stripe's annual letter, the company mentioned that 2024 was an "unusually good year". Stripe is benefiting from AI-related businesses ramping (partnerships with OpenAI, Anthropic, Perplexity, ElevenLabs, Mistral, and several more, with over 700 AI agent startups launching on Stripe in 2024), along with continued large enterprise wins/expanded partnerships, and ongoing traction with SaaS platforms (via Stripe Connect) of all sizes (ranging from brand new vertical SaaS businesses to Shopify). In addition, we believe that Braintree's decision to refocus on profitable growth (and thus, ceding ~$100b in annualized volume to the broader industry), could potentially benefit a number of competitors, including Stripe, Adyen, Chase, Fiserv, Worldpay, and others over the course of 2024-2026 (Stripe and Adyen in particular, given customer overlap with Braintree). While Adyen was historically focused on serving large multinational enterprises, they will increasingly compete with Stripe in RFPs for larger SaaS platforms and marketplaces (where Stripe also has a meaningful footprint, and Adyen is continuing to ramp their offering [Stripe with 76 platforms > $1b annualized in 2023 vs. Adyen with 18 platforms > €1b annualized in 2H 2023, increasing to 28 platforms in 2H 2024]), as well as increasingly in enterprise as Stripe continues to have success with enterprise customers (e.g., NVIDIA, PepsiCo, NewsCorp, and Comcast, per below). ´´´

In reference to the 2024 volume growth rates (Stripe accelerated by ~1300bps vs. Adyen accelerating by ~400bps), it is worth noting that in Stripe's annual letter, the company mentioned that 2024 was an "unusually good year". Stripe is benefiting from AI-related businesses ramping (partnerships with OpenAI, Anthropic, Perplexity, ElevenLabs, Mistral, and several more, with over 700 AI agent startups launching on Stripe in 2024), along with continued large enterprise wins/expanded partnerships, and ongoing traction with SaaS platforms (via Stripe Connect) of all sizes (ranging from brand new vertical SaaS businesses to Shopify). In addition, we believe that Braintree's decision to refocus on profitable growth (and thus, ceding ~$100b in annualized volume to the broader industry), could potentially benefit a number of competitors, including Stripe, Adyen, Chase, Fiserv, Worldpay, and others over the course of 2024-2026 (Stripe and Adyen in particular, given customer overlap with Braintree). For added context, Stripe's $1.4tr volume and ~38% YoY growth in 2024 compares to Adyen's 2024 volume of a similar ~$1.4tr (~€1.3tr), albeit with ~33% YoY growth (or growth of ~27% excluding an individual large merchant, Cash App, removed for comparability / size and one time nature). Stripe noted the company was profitable in 2024 (and expects to be profitable in 2025 and beyond). We note that Adyen reported a ~50% EBITDA margin in 2024, which we estimate will expand to ~55% in 2025E and ~60% in 2026E. Adyen has been profitable since 2011, according to 
reports
, and was generating ~44% EBITDA margins in 2015 (earliest figures from IPO prospectus), which peaked at ~63% in 2021. Adyen had a net income margin of ~46% in 2024 (with limited add backs for D&A, stock-based compensation, etc.). In reference to the 2024 volume growth rates (Stripe accelerated by ~1300bps vs. Adyen accelerating by ~400bps), it is worth noting that in Stripe's annual letter, the company mentioned that 2024 was an "unusually good year". Stripe is benefiting from AI-related businesses ramping (partnerships with OpenAI, Anthropic, Perplexity, ElevenLabs, Mistral, and several more, with over 700 AI agent startups launching on Stripe in 2024), along with continued large enterprise wins/expanded partnerships, and ongoing traction with SaaS platforms (via Stripe Connect) of all sizes (ranging from brand new vertical SaaS businesses to Shopify). In addition, we believe that Braintree's decision to refocus on profitable growth (and thus, ceding ~$100b in annualized volume to the broader industry), could potentially benefit a number of competitors, including Stripe, Adyen, Chase, Fiserv, Worldpay, and others over the course of 2024-2026 (Stripe and Adyen in particular, given customer overlap with Braintree). While Adyen was historically focused on serving large multinational enterprises, they will increasingly compete with Stripe in RFPs for larger SaaS platforms and marketplaces (where Stripe also has a meaningful footprint, and Adyen is continuing to ramp their offering [Stripe with 76 platforms > $1b annualized in 2023 vs. Adyen with 18 platforms > €1b annualized in 2H 2023, increasing to 28 platforms in 2H 2024]), as well as increasingly in enterprise as Stripe continues to have success with enterprise customers (e.g., NVIDIA, PepsiCo, NewsCorp, and Comcast, per below). ´´´

title: Vertical SaaS & Stripe Capital: Fueling SMB Growth
content:
Stripe notes the prevalence of vertical SaaS platforms among small businesses and the success of Stripe Capital in providing growth capital.: 

 ´´´Vertical SaaS highlights:
 Stripe notes that ~60% of small businesses in the US are using a vertical SaaS platform to help run their business. Further, more than ~14k platforms are using Stripe to power their payments offerings, with the company noting that in the US, ~6.3% of SMBs powered by vertical SaaS platforms on Stripe earn $1mm in total revenue in their first year (which is ~60% more than a comparison). As to Stripe Capital, the company noted that in 2024, hundreds of thousands of independent businesses logged into their system (i.e., a SaaS business with payments and embedded financial services powered by Stripe Connect and using Stripe Capital) and found an offer for growth capital waiting for them. The loans arrive in <48 hours and are repaid as sales are made on the platform (vs. repaying monthly). Further, the loans are largely used for investment in growth, with ~98% of those receiving a Stripe Capital loan stating an intention to repeat. ´´´

title: Stripe Dominates: Powering Fortune 100 & AI Economy
content:
Stripe is used by half of the Fortune 100 and sees success with its Revenue and Finance Automation suite, including Stripe Billing, used by numerous companies.: 

 ´´´Enterprise & Stripe Billing highlights: 
Further, the company noted that Stripe is now used by half of the Fortune 100 (including NVIDIA, PepsiCo, NewsCorp, and Comcast, among others), 80% of the Forbes Cloud 100, and 78% of the Forbes AI 50. Stripe noted that its Revenue and Finance Automation suite (with Billing at its core) has now passed a $500mm revenue run-rate (as the company forecasted in its 
2023 annual letter

Similar to prior years, Stripe’s success with enterprise platforms & merchants continues to be a key theme (discussed further in the company’s letter and in our research below). ´´´

title: Stripe's Fraud Fight: Protecting Billions in Transactions
content:
Stripe emphasizes fraud prevention, leveraging its reputation network and various techniques to reduce card testing and protect customers from fraudulent transactions.: 

 ´´´Comments on Fraud & Fraud Prevention:
 According to Stripe, fraud is a larger drag on the global economy than most believe, citing a report that found fraud costs ~3% of a typical business's online revenues. Stripe notes fraud as a central point of emphasis claiming that the most important lever they have to preserve the business is Stripe's reputation network, where they house data from ~$1.4tr in annual payments volume. When a card is used for a payment, there is a >92% chance that Stripe has encountered the same card before, and they can compare this transaction to prior behavior. Stripe provides examples of various techniques used to thwart fraudsters, including: 1) Building models that are passively learning which shipping addresses are owned by freight forwarders; 2) Use of counterintelligence teams across the deep web; and 3) Use of their Stripe Radar fraud model that can make a decision on a payment based on events that occurred 100 milliseconds ago across the Stripe network (part of which they have open-sourced). Using these methods, Stripe has reduced card testing on Stripe over ~80% over the past two years, protecting their customers from billions of fraudulent transactions.´´´

title: Stripe Embraces Stablecoins: Cheaper, Faster Money Movement
content:
Stripe acquired Bridge to enable stablecoin use cases, citing benefits like cheaper and faster money movement. Stablecoin transaction volumes have doubled.: 

 ´´´Bridge acquisition & discussion of stablecoins: 
Stripe announced the acquisition of the stablecoin orchestration platform, Bridge, in October 2024, enabling a number of use cases. According to Stripe, SpaceX uses Bridge to repatriate funds from Starlink sales in Argentina, Nigeria, and other markets. Further, DolarApp, a neobank in Mexico, uses Bridge to help individuals receive USD payments from payroll providers like Deel, and Airtim uses Bridge to disburse payments to workers all over LatAm. Stripe cites four important properties that highlight the importance of stablecoins vs. the status quo: 1) They make money movement cheaper; 2) They make money movement faster; 3) They are decentralized and open-access and thus globally available from day one; and 4) They are programmable. According to the letter, stablecoin transaction volumes more than doubled between Q4 2023 and Q4 2024, and the number of monthly active stablecoin wallets has now reached ~40mm. Stripe also gives two comparisons for reasoning about stablecoins - petrodollars and eurodollars. We recently published a recap from our 
Fireside with BVNK
 (technically a competitor of Bridge) where stablecoin adoption and implementation were at the center of discussion, especially as it relates to real-world application, use cases which include merchant settlement (via partnerships with PSPs), stablecoin payments, and marketplace / gig platform payouts.´´´

title: Stripe: A Global Payments Leader to Watch Closely
content:
Stripe's importance as a competitor in global payments and its ability to serve complex enterprise platforms make it crucial for investors to monitor its evolution.: 

 ´´´Broader industry context:
 Given the importance of Stripe as a key competitor in global payments and in many ways leading the innovation path for the industry, we continue to believe it is important for investors to be kept abreast of the company’s evolution. We note that Stripe’s global scale and ability to serve the most complex enterprise platforms & merchants (e.g., Shopify, Lightspeed Commerce, Uber, Airbnb, DoorDash, etc.), particularly as it pertains to competitive dynamics vs. Adyen (including Adyen for Platforms), PayPal (multiple offerings across Braintree and PayPal unbranded), Fiserv (including the ISV partner program, Clover Connect, etc.), Worldpay (45% owned by FIS, including Worldpay for Platforms), Global Payments (including Global Payments Integrated), Shift4, and others under coverage.´´´

 Given the importance of Stripe as a key competitor in global payments and in many ways leading the innovation path for the industry, we continue to believe it is important for investors to be kept abreast of the company’s evolution. We note that Stripe’s global scale and ability to serve the most complex enterprise platforms & merchants (e.g., Shopify, Lightspeed Commerce, Uber, Airbnb, DoorDash, etc.), particularly as it pertains to competitive dynamics vs. Adyen (including Adyen for Platforms), PayPal (multiple offerings across Braintree and PayPal unbranded), Fiserv (including the ISV partner program, Clover Connect, etc.), Worldpay (45% owned by FIS, including Worldpay for Platforms), Global Payments (including Global Payments Integrated), Shift4, and others under coverage.´´´

title: FinTech Conference Alert: Networking with Industry Leaders
content:
Announcement of the 8th Annual UBS Private FinTech Conference Networking Event with a list of participating companies.: 

 ´´´8th Annual UBS Private FinTech Conference Networking Event - May 15-16, 2025 in Napa, CA (welcome reception evening of May 14):
 We recently launched – 
registration is now open
 – our 
8th Annual Private Company FinTech Conference Networking Even
t
 on May 15-16, 2025 in Napa (welcome reception evening of May 14). Thus far, There are ~145+ private companies, industry participants, consultants, attorneys, and other experts registered, with a few examples including Plaid, Worldpay, Ramp, Brex, SpotOn, Spreedly, SumUp, Trustly, Tipalti, Qu, Melio, Airwallex, Fortis, NMI, Finix, Rainforest, Infinicept, Gr4vy, Highnote, Lithic, Modern Treasury, Signifyd, Unit, Celero, CardFlight, and many more (large ISOs, industry consultants [BCG, Glenbrook Partners, Flagship Advisory, Bain, Deloitte, Utopaya, Parachute, etc.], etc.). This conference will provide ample open space for networking and relationship building with industry peers, experts, thought leaders and executives. We will kick off with an evening welcome reception on Wednesday, May 14, followed by presentations, one-on-one meetings, and networking events on Thursday, May 15 and Friday, May 16. Link to registration 
here
. For further information, please reach out our team or UBS sales.´´´

title: Stripe Tour NYC: Enterprise Partnerships & Platform Enhancements
content:
UBS attended Stripe Tour New York, highlighting Stripe's product updates, enterprise partnerships, and support for various payment providers.: 

 ´´´Stripe Tour New York 2024: 
We attended Stripe Tour New York where the company shared its product updates from the last six months with Stripe customers (founders and enterprise leaders), developers, partners, and industry participants. We came away with additional insights with respect to Stripe’s enhanced and expanding enterprise partnerships, Stripe Link (with both card and bank-based funding options), embedded financial services, Stripe’s Optimized Checkout Suite, Stripe Terminal (including the partnership announcement with FreedomPay), Stripe Billing, Stripe Connect, Stripe Issuing, Stripe Treasury, additional payment methods, and more. The day consisted of presentations, panels, product demonstrations/expositions, and fireside chats, including a closing fireside chat with Patrick Collison (co-founder of Stripe) and Lloyd Blankfein (Chairman of Goldman Sachs). While there were a number of announcements and observations with competitive implications across our coverage, we highlight: 1) Continued emphasis on Stripe's platform being available in a processor agnostic manner manner (i.e., Stripe Billing, RADAR, etc. across both Stripe and alternate processors); 2) Further share gains in enterprise (announcing NVIDIA, Pepsi, Rivian, AMC Networks, Cloudflare, Forbes, and ClickFunnels); and 3) Continued emphasis on expanding support for more payment providers and Stripe Link (particularly as it relates to the broader category of autofill offerings from Stripe, Shopify, and PayPal [Fastlane], among others). We provide summaries of selected key announcements and updates from Stripe Tour NYC. Full report with additional details and a broader recap of the event 
here´´´

The day consisted of presentations, panels, product demonstrations/expositions, and fireside chats, including a closing fireside chat with Patrick Collison (co-founder of Stripe) and Lloyd Blankfein (Chairman of Goldman Sachs). While there were a number of announcements and observations with competitive implications across our coverage, we highlight: 1) Continued emphasis on Stripe's platform being available in a processor agnostic manner manner (i.e., Stripe Billing, RADAR, etc. across both Stripe and alternate processors); 2) Further share gains in enterprise (announcing NVIDIA, Pepsi, Rivian, AMC Networks, Cloudflare, Forbes, and ClickFunnels); and 3) Continued emphasis on expanding support for more payment providers and Stripe Link (particularly as it relates to the broader category of autofill offerings from Stripe, Shopify, and PayPal [Fastlane], among others). We provide summaries of selected key announcements and updates from Stripe Tour NYC. Full report with additional details and a broader recap of the event 
here´´´

title: Merchant Acquiring: Who's Winning the Payments Race?
content:
Updated analysis from "The Question 4.0" report, focusing on the dynamics of the US merchant acquiring market, swimlanes, and operating model options.: 

 ´´´Additional research: 
Updated figures and slide deck (Excel backup with industry analysis) from “The Question 4.0” - A framework for sizing and analyzing the various swimlanes of the US merchant acquiring market (and summary slide deck):
 In this report, we include updated figures for key aspects of our previously published analysis within “The Question 4.0” (April 2024 report) to better reflect Q2 2024 results and associated more recent estimate changes. Investors first asked the question, “Can the merchant acquiring businesses within Worldpay [45% owned by FIS], Fiserv, and Global Payments continue to grow ~HSD-LDD with platforms like Stripe, Adyen, Toast, Shopify, Square, Clover (owned by Fiserv), Braintree, Checkout.com now at greater scale?" (analysis of global volumes). Later, the question evolved to, “How much runway is left in the US in terms of acquiring revenue?”(analysis of US revenue). Further iterations of this analysis placed added focus on four broadly defined swimlanes within US merchant acquiring: 1) Software platforms (owned horizontal & vertical SaaS businesses such as Square, Toast, Shopify, Clover, etc.); 2) Payments partners (merchant acquirers & PSPs such as Stripe Connect, Adyen for Platforms, Global Payments Integrated, etc. that embed payments into software); 3) SMB direct (traditional payments distribution not tightly integrated to a POS and/or other software platform); and 4) Enterprise and large merchants (direct distribution to enterprise and large merchants). The report also expands upon the software-led channel within the SMB segment, outlining the range of operating model options SaaS businesses have for partnering with PSPs, including illustrative unit economics implications for both the payments company and the SaaS business. The intention of the report is to outline the debate and present a quantitative framework for thinking about share gains & losses within US merchant acquiring over the next ~5 years. Updated Excel analysis of all data from “The Question 4.0” available by request. Additionally, we also published an updated version of "The Question 4.0" slide deck 
here
 and 
data update
 here. ´´´

title: Europe's Payments Shift: Adyen Leads the Software Charge
content:
Analysis of software-led payments in Europe, highlighting Adyen's position to capitalize on this trend and its increasing number of platforms processing over €1bn annually.: 

 ´´´Europe - is now the time for software-led in Europe? We think it is….:
 We address the key question in European payments – will software-led payments be a key vector of growth for the coming 5-10 years? We draw a parallel with the evidence from the US, where between 2015 to 2020 processors with the greatest exposure to software-led payments experienced strong double-digit growth in their software-led divisions. As a result, traditional in-store payments distribution channels (i.e. banks) lost share. Our hypothesis was to test if this dynamic could apply to Europe. As of today, Europe has not seen such a rise, with bank distribution still predominant in the region (~50% of SME payment volume, vs ~20% in the US). Full report 
here
. Adyen best positioned to capitalise on software-led payments in Europe - our Q-Series 
report
 highlights that we are still in what we believe to be the infancy of a shift to software-led distribution of payments in Europe, with penetration of the total addressable market (TAM) at ~24%. We expect the volume of software-led payments in Europe to grow ~2x the overall carded market at a ~18% 2023-28E CAGR. Although Adyen for Platforms (AfP) is still at an early stage (~14% of full stack total payments volume [TPV]), Adyen continues to win logos and now has 22 platforms processing > €1bn annually (versus 15 platforms at 2Q 2023). We believe AfP TPV in Europe will ramp alongside penetration increases as it has become a preferred partner for many software platforms in the region. Full report 
here
.´´´

title: TIGO Stock Performance
content:
Millicom (TIGO) fell 6%; closing of the SDR may have caused this. Fundamentals are even stronger after Q4, reinforcing Buy rating.: 

 ´´´ 
Millicom (TIGO) 
fell 6% in the past seven days, underperforming LatAm and global peers. Our take: The closing of the SDR may have caused this, since volumes are still not fully migrated to the stock listed in the US. The earnings were very strong and surpassed our and consensus expectations. It’s hard to determine precisely when the technical issues with the stock will end, but it shouldn’t be more than a few weeks, we believe. The fundamentals are even stronger after Q4, so we reinforce our Buy rating and Millicom as one of the best Telecom stories in LatAm right now. [
4Q24 strong results: All about cash; FCF 70% above consensus and more to come in 2025E
]´´´

title: Mercado Libre Expands in Nuevo León!
content:
Mercado Libre is expanding operations in Nuevo León with a new distribution center and investments of US$180m, expecting to increase its workforce to 3.3k. They also signed an agreement with the government of Nuevo León to support local SMEs.: 

 ´´´Mercado Libre inaugurates a distribution center and announces another in Mx
 
According to 
El Economista
, Mercado Libre inaugurated a distribution center in Apocada and announced investments of US$180m for a new one to expand operations in Nuevo León. The company estimates that the expansion should increase its workforce to 3.3k from 1.3k in the labor plant. Moreover, MELI and the government of Nuevo León signed an agreement to strengthen local SMEs. The agreement will allow SMEs in the state to register in a special registry to market their products on MELI’s platform. ´´´

title: MELI Expansion vs. Amazon Competition
content:
Positive for Mercado Libre, further investments in logistics should continue supporting GMV growth. title: Bradesco's Challenges
content:
Strategic holders divest from Bradesco due to lack of visibility on turnaround and doubts about capital quality.: 

 ´´´Brazil bank stocks:
 (-) Bradesco:
 We spoke with long-term strategic BBDC holders who decided to divest from the stock due to lack of visibility on when and if the turnaround will happen, and doubts about the quality of its capital. Some believe that when the time comes for loan growth to accelerate, Bradesco could be in a weaker capital position versus peers. ´´´

title: Banks Cautious Despite 4Q24 Support
content:
Investors were somewhat disappointed by the decelerating loan growth expectations embedded in 2025 guidance (mid-point guidance indicates 7.5% for Banco do Brasil, 6.5% for Itaú, and 6% for Bradesco), though some eventually concurred that the underlying positive message was that regardless of a rising Selic rate environment, and the ~80% correlation between the Selic rate and NPLs in Brazil, NPLs might not rise significantly as banks are trying to mitigate the effects of higher rates.: 

 ´´´4Q24 wrap-up
 The 4Q24 earning season took place during our roadshow, providing us with the opportunity to check investor sentiment in real time. In a nutshell, we have rarely seen such a large asymmetry between the past (supportive 4Q24 numbers) and future (conservative 2025 guidance), and consider this stark difference as a clear sign of banks’ being cautious. Investors were somewhat disappointed by the decelerating loan growth expectations embedded in 2025 guidance (mid-point guidance indicates 7.5% for Banco do Brasil, 6.5% for Itaú, and 6% for Bradesco). Though some eventually concurred that the underlying positive message was that regardless of a rising Selic rate environment, and the ~80% correlation between the Selic rate and NPLs in Brazil, NPLs might not rise significantly as banks are trying to mitigate the effects of higher rates.´´´

title: Andean Banks Outlook
content:
Constructive sentiment towards Mexican and Andean banks. Top pick Banco de Chile. Positive view on Peru banks, and particularly with Credicorp: 

 ´´´Mexico and Andean region:
 We believe that the overall sentiment toward Mexican and Andean banks is constructive. In 
Mexico
, the investors with whom we spoke see current valuations as cheap, as they try to reconcile the banks’ bullish loan growth guidance with the country’s economic deceleration and lingering trade uncertainty. Investors also were curious about our counter-consensus neutral view on Gentera, which is underpinned by what we see as a risky company strategy — diversifying into individual lending; in addition, the company lacks structural operating leverage (which implies ROE compression in the event of sharp loan growth deceleration). We also noticed renewed interest in 
Chile
 from a top-down perspective, and we spoke positively about Banco de Chile as our top pick in that country, as we see the company as strongly positioned for our expected macro and political outlook (i.e., higher for longer inflation and interest rates + resumed loan growth after several years of stagnant performance in real terms). In 
Colombia
, investors seemed surprised by our skeptical view of the recent rally, which we believe does not account for the country’s structural macro weaknesses and the possibility of political stagnation. Finally, we had good traction with our positive view on 
Peru
 banks, and particularly with Credicorp as our overall top pick; investors agreed that the risk/reward (i.e., electoral noise vs. loan growth recovery) is skewed to the upside at Credicorp’s current valuation (i.e., 1.5x P/BV).´´´

title: Google's AI-Powered Search Revolution!
content:
Google launches AI Mode in Search, powered by Gemini 2.0, offering advanced query handling for Google One AI Premium subscribers.: 

 ´´´Google Launches AI Mode in Search
Google has launched an experimental feature named AI Mode in its Search platform, utilizing the advanced capabilities of the Gemini 2.0 AI model. This feature enhances AI Overviews, allowing for more complex query handling such as coding and advanced mathematics, without the need for users to sign in. AI Mode facilitates deeper exploration, reasoning, and comparison through a 'query fan-out' method, pulling information from diverse sources like Google's Knowledge Graph and shopping data. Initially, this feature is available only to Google One AI Premium subscribers as an opt-in experiment via Google Labs. This development marks Google's continued push towards integrating sophisticated AI into its search functionalities to offer a more interactive and comprehensive search experience.´´´

title: Alibaba's QwQ-32B: A New AI Reasoning Challenger
content:
Alibaba's Qwen team has released QwQ-32B, a new AI reasoning model that rivals larger models like DeepSeek-R1. The model, which excels in math and coding tasks, is available under an open-source license.: 

 ´´´Alibaba's QwQ-32B: The New Challenger in AI Reasoning
 
Last updated 
8 minutes ago
Alibaba's Qwen team has released QwQ-32B, a new reasoning model with 32 billion parameters that rivals the performance of much larger models like DeepSeek-R1, which has 671 billion parameters. This model, which excels in math and coding tasks due to enhanced reinforcement learning techniques, has sparked discussions on the efficiency and potential of smaller AI models. QwQ-32B is available under an open-source license, promoting its widespread use and further development. The release has been met with enthusiasm, with many in the AI community noting its competitive performance against giants like DeepSeek and OpenAI, suggesting a shift towards more accessible, open-source AI solutions.´´´

title: Wegovy Discount & Market Impact
content:
Novo Nordisk introduces NovoCare Pharmacy, offering Wegovy at a discounted price of $499/month. Hims & Hers faces stock pressure. : 

 ´´´See new posts
Novo Nordisk Introduces Discounted Wegovy
Last updated
1 hour ago
Novo Nordisk has introduced NovoCare Pharmacy, a direct-to-consumer online service, to sell its obesity drug Wegovy at a reduced price of $499 per month for cash-paying patients. This initiative aims to make the drug more accessible to those without insurance, including Medicare recipients, by offering it at less than half its previous price of $1,350. The move follows the end of the FDA shortage of semaglutide, intensifying competition in the weight loss drug market. This pricing strategy has led to a positive market response, with Novo Nordisk's shares increasing, while competitors like Hims & Hers faced stock pressure due to the price reduction.´´´
